Translational Hand Controller

Nice, seen that prop on the left before but without the arrows on top, though it looks to be out of arm-reach for a kerbal (though frankly pretty much everything in an IVA including in stock ones is) a bit annoying that IVAs are laid out and scaled to fit a human shaped pilot but kerbals aren't, feels like a weird disconnect, but I guess it's expected, when you see from a first person perspective you assume the body you inhabit has the same general proportions as you're used to.
Alex, I'm wondering if you'll tackle a command pod styled for interplanetary flight/grand tours with all these props you've made.

Nice, seen that prop on the left before but without the arrows on top, though it looks to be out of arm-reach for a kerbal (though frankly pretty much everything in an IVA including in stock ones is) a bit annoying that IVAs are laid out and scaled to fit a human shaped pilot but kerbals aren't, feels like a weird disconnect, but I guess it's expected, when you see from a first person perspective you assume the body you inhabit has the same general proportions as you're used to.

I have tried to place dashboards considering kerbal's anatomy .. but what is useful for Kerbals pilots is not very suitable for people players.
Yeah I came to the same conclusion modifying/adding IVAs to parts, if you scale it so kerbals could reach everything it's all pretty much in your face.

... it's all pretty much in your face.

oh yes

and it's not a zoom...

XD

10 characters
So when can we expect to get our hands on all these spiffy IVA goodies for testing?

Perhaps this should be in the RPM thread, but since most people here would be using them: I'm having trouble using the monitors - I'm getting "No satellite connection" on one screen that I presume is meant to be ScanSat maps, and "No Autopilot installed" on another, which I think is a reference to MechJeb. However, the ship has both. However, they are added by ModuleManager, rather than having the parts themselvse. Is that an issue?

Perhaps this should be in the RPM thread, but since most people here would be using them: I'm having trouble using the monitors - I'm getting "No satellite connection" on one screen that I presume is meant to be ScanSat maps, and "No Autopilot installed" on another, which I think is a reference to MechJeb. However, the ship has both. However, they are added by ModuleManager, rather than having the parts themselvse. Is that an issue?

Do you install "MechJeb2RPM" and "SCANsatRPM" plugins?
I've MM:ed on ScanSat and MJ as well, works for me, I'm guessing you're lacking those bridge plug-ins

Do you install "MechJeb2RPM" and "SCANsatRPM" plugins?

I had them, but they seem to have disappeared. Thanks, will replace them and see if that gets it running correctly.

I agree with ZobrAz. That annunciator volume needs to be at least as loud as the engine noise. You wouldn't want to miss a warning message.

Select target, orbiting at Kerbin

And when the"EJECT ANGLE" is close to zero, perform your burn

http://i.imgur.com/bciMcQc.jpg

I only see the phase angle on my screens... but it does change and when it's zero, that turns out to be the right time to burn (was heading for the Mun if that's any help and I checked in map view for confirmation) so I don't know what that means, but it happened.
It would be nice to have a Mk1 and Mk3 cockpit for Airplanes, with all that keys controls and screens too.
